title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 14 February 2012 - XWiki
content:
00:16 <rrodriguez> has quit  
01:12 <jvdrean> has quit  
04:59 <rrodriguez> has joined #xwiki  
05:23 <DrLou> has quit  
05:59 <Denis1> has joined #xwiki  
05:59 <Denis> has quit  
07:30 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
07:39 <@sdumitriu> Quick everyone, let's all jump on him!  
07:40 <@sdumitriu> (Good morning Vincent)  
07:40 <vmassol> sdumitriu: already jumped on him! :)  
07:40 <vmassol> good morning Sergiu  
07:42 <@sdumitriu> Yes, I noticed you were ahead of me  
07:44 <vmassol> here she goes again!  
07:44 <vmassol> want to have a go sdumitriu? :)  
07:45 <vmassol> (if she creates some unwanted content… maybe she understood)  
07:45 <vmassol> hmm btw we have a bug  
07:45 <vmassol> she still has her old Activity Stream  
07:46 <vmassol> so if a user named John Doe creates an account, removes his account and somenoe else called the same creates a an account with the same name  
07:46 <vmassol> he'll inherit the AS from the old user  
07:46 <vmassol> :)  
07:46 <vmassol> it's a small bug though but still a bug...  
07:50 <@sdumitriu> Yes...  
07:50 <@sdumitriu> But I don't know any way of fixing this  
07:50 <@sdumitriu> Since removing the events corresponding to a user isn't something nice  
07:50 <@sdumitriu> Although it might be useful...  
07:50 <vmassol> we'd need to use a uuid instead of the user name  
07:50 <@sdumitriu> Since otherwise spam would be left in the wiki  
07:51 <vmassol> yes it can be useful  
07:51 <vmassol> as an special admin feature  
07:51 <@sdumitriu> Yep  
07:55 <@sdumitriu> Going to sleep, bye  
07:55 <vmassol> bye  
07:55 <sdumitriu> has quit

10:13 <vmassol> cjd: memory has grown again since yesterday: https://skitch.com/e-vmassol/8bmw1/monitoring-javamelody-on-xwiki-vxwikiorgfarm.xpertnet.biz  
10:25 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
10:26 <tmortagne> has left #xwiki  
10:27 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
10:32 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
10:35 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
10:43 <+tmortagne> hi guys  
10:44 <vmassol> hi tmortagne  
10:44 <+tmortagne> who wants to be build manager  
10:44 <+tmortagne> ?  
10:44 <vmassol> I think we all need to work on fixing the build today  
10:44 <vmassol> since it's release day and we've failed to fix it in the past days :(  
10:44 <vmassol> mflorea: are you there?  
10:44 <+tmortagne> sure but still we don't have any build manager this week  
10:44 <vmassol> yep  
10:45 <+mflorea> vmassol: yes  
10:45 <vmassol> (your status is offline mflorea btw)  
10:45 <vmassol> mflorea: the ui tests have still not all run  
10:45 <vmassol> they're still hanging  
10:45 <+mflorea> my status is "do not disturb"  
10:45 <+mflorea> (since I'm at work)  
10:45 <vmassol> I wanted to investigate yesterday  
10:45 <vmassol> that's funny  
10:45 <vmassol> 'the do not disturb'  
10:46 <+mflorea> :)  
10:46 <vmassol> sorry for disturbing you then!  
10:46 <vmassol> I'll shut up  
10:46 <vmassol> :)  
10:46 <vmassol> going to be hard to sync though  
10:47 <vmassol> can I disturb you? :)  
10:48 <+mflorea> sure  
10:48 <vmassol> I was saying that I wanted to investigate and I wanted to remotely access the xtighvnc instance in order to see what's on the screen when a test hangs on the agent. But I haven't been able to set up a ssh tunnel to do this yet. I needed help from infra team but didn't get any answer  
10:48 <vmassol> do you know how to do that?  
10:49 <+mflorea> unfortunately no :(  
10:51 <vmassol> mflorea: please don't kill the ui tests  
10:51 <vmassol> I'm going to try again to connect to it  
10:51 <+mflorea> ok  
10:51 <vmassol> once someone from infra answers  
10:58 <Denis1> vmassol: isn't something like this working ?: -L 5900:127.0.0.1:5900  
10:59 <vmassol> I'm chatting with infra now  
10:59 <vmassol> thanks  
10:59 <Denis1> is now known as <Denis>  
11:38 <vmassol> mflorea: I'm in :)  
11:39 <vmassol> it's still the same problem: https://skitch.com/e-vmassol/8bcrf/hudsonagents-x-desktop-ks365275.kimsufi.com-1  
11:39 <+mflorea> yep..  
11:39 <vmassol> the page behind was moving when I wtached it so it doesn't reflect where the problem is  
11:59 <vmassol> guys this afternoon I need to start preparing a presentation that I'm giving on Thursday so I won't have much time to help unfrotunately  
12:00 <vmassol> mflorea: could I leave it to you to look at the issues with the ui tests ?  
12:06 <+mflorea> vmassol: sure

13:13 <mflorea> has quit  
13:55 <vmassol> tmortagne: do you know why we don't build platform on agents 3-6?  
13:55 <vmassol> ah no it's not for this reason  
13:55 <vmassol> hmm strange  
13:55 <vmassol> it wasnt building and I started manually the rendering module  
13:55 <vmassol> and now platform syas it's waiting for rendering  
14:01 <nIMBVS> has joined #xwiki  
14:15 <+tmortagne> vmassol: platform is supposed to wait for its dependencies to be done building, that's how we configured it  
14:16 <vmassol> yes but there were no dep being built  
14:16 <vmassol> I triggered the rendering job after  
14:16 <+tmortagne> I tough you said that you started rendering  
14:16 <vmassol> look now  
14:16 <vmassol> it's waiting for agent1 and 2 only  
14:17 <vmassol> so my question stays actually :)  
14:17 <vmassol> we don't want to run platform on agents 3-6?  
14:17 <+tmortagne> the fact that platform is buildeing on aagent1 and 2 is normal  
14:17 <vmassol> that looks like a bottleneck  
14:17 <vmassol> since only 2 agents out of 6 are working  
14:17 <+tmortagne> ui tests contently fail on 3-6 since a long time now  
14:18 <vmassol> always?  
14:18 <vmassol> if that's the case it's high time we do something about it  
14:18 <+tmortagne> most of the time from what I remember  
14:18 <vmassol> becuase right now we have only 2 agents basically  
14:18 <+tmortagne> yes  
14:30 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
14:33 <vmassol> very interesting: http://engineering.linkedin.com/testing/continuous-integration-mobile  
14:33 <vmassol> especially the layout tests which we could do too  
14:39 <vmassol> guys what is this page http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/XWikiAndEclipse ?  
14:39 <vmassol> should it be moved to the draft space? it doesn't look finished  
14:39 <vmassol> some guy just clicked on a question mark and created a new empty page...  
14:40 <vmassol> tmortagne: don't we already have docs on xwiki and eclipse ?  
14:41 <vmassol> hmm seems outdated: http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/BuildingInEclipse  
14:41 <+tmortagne> vmassol: yes wa have several documentations atround XWiki and Eclipse  
14:41 <vmassol> the eclipse/xwiki doc seems a bit scattered and outdated  
14:41 <+tmortagne> the only one up to date is http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/DebugXEWithEclipse I think  
14:42 <vmassol> would be great if someone could reorganize this doc a bit  
14:42 <vmassol> I see the outdated doc is linked from http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/DevelopmentTools#HEclipse  
14:42 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
14:43 <vmassol> I'll fix http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/BuildingInIdea  
14:45 <+tmortagne> building on Eclipse is not really a very good idea IMO, easier with maven itself. I doubt anyone is doing it, probably why the doc has not been updated.  
14:45 <vmassol> building means loading  
14:46 <vmassol> ie setting up in your IDE  
14:46 <vmassol> we can rename the page  
14:46 <vmassol> I'll rename the idea page  
14:47 <DrLou> has joined #xwiki  
14:48 <+tmortagne>  then there is everything needed on http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/DebugXEWithEclipse if the need is to setup up a Eclipse dev environment to work with XWiki  
15:11 <@sdumitriu> mflorea: Regarding comment preview, I was expecting the problem to be fixed by adding "&sheet=" to the URL  
15:11 <@sdumitriu> Why doesn't that override the sheet? That's what I understood from the sheet module documentation  
15:21 <+mflorea> sdumitriu: the sheet must exist. The sheet manager checks if the sheet document exists. Now, if you're asking why "" is no resolved as current document, that is because SheetRequestInitializer puts the sheet parameter on the execution context only if sheet request param is not empty.  
15:22 <@sdumitriu> OK  
15:23 <@sdumitriu> I tried to pass the current document as well  
15:23 <@sdumitriu> sheet=Blog.WebHome  
15:23 <@sdumitriu> But then nothing gets displayed  
15:24 <+mflorea> Because the content of Blog.WebHome doesn't display anything  
15:24 <+mflorea> that's normak  
15:24 <+mflorea> you need a sheet that display the content from the request  
15:24 <+mflorea> or the current content  
15:25 <+mflorea> i.e. a sheet that does what rendercontent.vm does  
15:25 <+mflorea> (should do, actually)  
15:27 <+mflorea> A/B?sheet=Space.Page means render the content of Space.Page in the context of A.B  
15:29 <@sdumitriu> Ah, I see why it doesn't work with the same document as the sheet  
15:29 <+mflorea> so either we define a sheet for previewing comments, or we fix rendercontent.vm to take into account if the content is specified on the request.  
15:29 <@sdumitriu> The passed content isn't taken into account since the sheet is requested from the database  
15:30 <+mflorea> yes  
15:32 <+tmortagne> vmassol: can I force xwiki-manager to stop ? as far as I can see in http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-manager/4165/console looks like it's a jenkins issue since it did not seems to have executed maven at all  
15:32 <+tmortagne> checking agent version  
15:32 <vmassol> tmortagne: manager has been having this problem all the time for the past days  
15:33 <vmassol> yes you can stop it but next time it runs it'll be the same  
15:33 <+tmortagne> vmassol: I don't understand how it can come from xwiki-manager itself since I don't see anything in the console  
15:35 <+tmortagne> looks like the slave used on agent-2 is pretty old compared to root jenkins, 1.423 instead of 1.449  
15:35 <+tmortagne> samee for agent-1  
15:35 <+tmortagne> and probably others too I guess  
15:36 <vmassol> yes would be good to upgrade them  
15:36 <+tmortagne> doing it  
15:36 <vmassol> upgrading jenkins too first maybe  
15:36 <vmassol> so that we don't have to do ti again in a few days  
15:36 <+tmortagne> checking the release note  
15:45 <+tmortagne> starting upgrade of root jenkins  
15:45 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
15:54 <@sdumitriu> vmassol: Just realised that there's a problem with the license headers in the XML files  
15:54 <@sdumitriu> In theory, the wiki content is under CC-SA  
15:54 <@sdumitriu> Not LGPL  
15:55 <@sdumitriu> So the pom should be updated  
15:56 <@sdumitriu> "See the NOTICE file distributed with this work" => there's no NOTICE file in XARs either, so the message is misleading  
15:56 <vmassol> sdumitriu: ok  
15:56 <vmassol> we should have one  
15:56 <@sdumitriu> Yes, we should  
15:58 <dbaeli> vmassol: Back on confluence conversion subject : the use of converter works great, some issues with code macro inside a panel macro. Where should I report the issue ? http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XRENDERING ?  
16:00 <vmassol> dbaeli: yes  
16:00 <vmassol> thanks!  
16:00 <dbaeli> ok, so I'll check on lastest first, then report.  
16:00 <vmassol> great  
16:00 <dbaeli> stable-3.3.x ?  
16:01 <dbaeli> stable-3.4.x ?  
16:01 <dbaeli> What is the lastest to test with ? :-)  
16:01 <vmassol> 3.5-SNAPSHOT  
16:02 <vmassol> if you mean the latest on central repo it's 3.4 AFAIR  
16:02 <dbaeli> Oups even better, 3.5 ... we're a bit late @eXo.  
16:02 <vmassol> otherwise the latest from the xwiki repo is 3?5-SNAPSHOT  
16:02 <vmassol> 3.5  
16:03 <dbaeli> I'll manage to get the lastest from xwiki repo. Thanks.  
16:03 <vmassol> dbaeli: ok great. It's cool that you're doing some xwiki dev. Please report anything you'd like to see improved!  
16:03 <vmassol> (feel free to ping me on skype if you wish to talk too)  
16:04 <dbaeli> ok, I'll do.  
16:04 <dbaeli> First I'll act as good citizen and report. I'll ping you tomorrow probably.  
16:05 <vmassol> yep good  
16:10 <+tmortagne> jenkins fully upgraded including slaves  
16:10 <vmassol> cool  
16:10 <+tmortagne> upgrading maven on agents now  
16:10 <+sburjan> cool  
16:10 <+tmortagne> and FF I guess  
16:10 <vmassol> tmortagne: you missed plugins  
16:10 <+tmortagne> what do you mean ?  
16:10 <vmassol> we should upgrade them too  
16:10 <vmassol> http://ci.xwiki.org/pluginManager/  
16:11 <+tmortagne> did not really checked if there was new versions of plugins  
16:11 <+tmortagne> I tough maven plugin was integrated actually  
16:11 <+tmortagne> I mean bundled  
16:12 <+tmortagne> especially since I can see it in the changelog  
16:12 <vmassol> it is but I don't thin it's upgraded automatically  
16:12 <vmassol> (if you already have it installed)  
16:12 <+tmortagne> I don't understand, if it's bundled how could it be not updated  
16:12 <vmassol> I don't know  
16:13 <+tmortagne> starting with git and github plugins  
16:14 <+tmortagne> maybe I need to uninstall the plugin actually  
16:14 <+tmortagne> will try that  
16:20 <dbaeli> Done http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XRENDERING-172 I'll be back later on. Thank you.  
16:21 <vmassol> yep seen it, thanks  
16:21 <vmassol> mflorea: when do we create a branch for 3.5 ?  
16:21 <+mflorea> it's done by the release script  
16:22 <vmassol> IMO we should release from a branch always and create the branch 3-4 days before the release day  
16:22 <vmassol> to improve stabilization  
16:22 <+mflorea> well, I'll have to see with sdumitriu, since the script checks for "RC"  
16:22 <+mflorea> and we voted for no RC  
16:23 <vmassol> indeed that'll fail the script  
16:27 <@sdumitriu> I can create the branch already  
16:33 <@sdumitriu> Doing it

17:36 <+tmortagne> vmassol: did you upgraded maven shade plugin ?  
17:36 <+tmortagne> looks like it has an issue with xwiki-rendering-standalone: it can't resolve org.xwiki.commons:xwiki-commons-pom:pom:4.0-SNAPSHOT  
17:36 <+tmortagne> see http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-rendering/555/console  
17:37 <+tmortagne> if the version of the plugin did not changed I don't understand why it's failing to find a pom that was used in all project built before it  
17:39 <nIMBVS> has quit

17:43 <vmassol> checking console  
17:43 <vmassol> what I did upgrade is the archertype plugin  
17:43 <vmassol> but that's after  
17:43 <vmassol> so it's not that  
17:44 <vmassol>  org.xwiki.commons:xwiki-commons-pom:pom:4.0-SNAPSHOT  
17:44 <vmassol> there's no 4.0-SNAPSHOT  
17:44 <vmassol> si that's normal no?  
17:44 <vmassol> s/si/so/  
17:44 <vmassol> that's probably caused by sergiu's recent commits to create the branch

17:45 <+tmortagne> otherwise the whole rendering would not build at all  
17:45 <dbaeli> has joined #xwiki

17:55 <+sburjan> hello everybody. I wanted to ask you on which ports does an xwiki instance binds by default ? 8080 for http/https and and 8079 for Monitor/Debug ?
